abstract: Experts warn Chinese Pres Xi Jinping's pledge to erect national market for greenhouse gas quotas, while admirable, will require years of effort and changes on part of Chinese government, and even then market may not succeed; local trials that have been set up in country since 2013 have mixed record.
lead_paragraph: With its heavy-handed interventions, poor statistics and corruption, China will need years to build a market that substantially cuts emissions, experts said.

headline.main: Enacting Cap-and-Trade Will Present Challenges Under China’s System
headline.print_headline: China Faces Major Obstacles in Plan to Cut Greenhouse Gases, Experts Say

snippet: With its heavy-handed interventions, poor statistics and corruption, China will need years to build a market that substantially cuts emissions, experts said.

keywords.value: Carbon Caps and Emissions Trading Programs
keywords.name: subject
